intro: Scorzonera scapigera, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and covered in fine pubescence. Scorzonera scapigera is a biennial or short-lived perennial, typically reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats.
